    Enrichment map

    enrichment_map.Rd

    This functions calculates similarities between gene-sets and plot a resulting enrichment map

    Usage

    enrichment_map(
  gs_score,
  gs_list,
  method = c("overlap", "jaccard"),
  coeff = NULL,
  all_gs = TRUE,
  comm_method = "fastgreedy",
  min_comm_size = 2,
  gs_list_size = NULL,
  set_sim_df = NULL,
  file_prefix = "en_map",
  layout = NULL,
  weight_within = 4,
  weight_between = 1,
  pal_community = NULL,
  pal_score = NULL,
  top_ptw = "score",
  wrap = 15,
  label_fontsize = c(6, 5),
  e_color = "gray65",
  e_alpha = 0.5,
  e_range = c(1, 4),
  v_stroke = 0.5,
  v_range = c(2, 8),
  save_plot = TRUE,
  width = 200,
  height = 200,
  res = 300,
  units = "mm"
)

    Arguments

    gs_score

    named vector of pathway scores

    gs_list

    gene set list

    method

    'overlap' or 'jaccard'

    coeff

    threshold for the similarity score between two gene sets

    all_gs

    TRUE/FALSE, indicating if all gene-sets should be considered or only the ones with similarity score >= `coeff`

    comm_method

    community algorithm to be used; available algorithms are c("fastgreedy", "labprop", "walktrap", "eigen", "multilev", "infomap") see `Ulisse::find_communities()` for further details

    min_comm_size

    minimum size of a community to be considered in the enrichment map. If `min_comm_size = 1` and `all_gs = TRUE`, then all gene-sets are displayed

    gs_list_size

    named vector with size f the gene-sets in `gs_list`

    set_sim_df

    optional, data.frame with three columns 'set1', 'set2' and 'sim'

    file_prefix

    prefix used to save similarity data.frame and enrichment map plot (if `save_plot = TRUE`)

    layout

    optional layout matrix, composed of two columns. If not provided, the layout is calculated by using `igraph::layout_with_fr()` function, together with `weight_within` and `weight_between` (via `Ulisse::edge_weights()` function)

    weight_within

    value to weight the attraction between two vertices of the same community

    weight_between

    value to weight the attraction between two vertices of two distinct communities

    pal_community

    palette to be used to color communities, should be a named vector with a color for each community. If not provided, `pals::alphabet2()` is used instead

    pal_score

    palette to be used to color vertices according to their `score`. If not provided, `pals::brewer.greens(n = 3)` is used

    top_ptw

    variable used to select top gene-sets to display as a description of the communities. Should be either `"score"` (to display top score gene-set for each community) or `"n_genes"` (to display gene-set with higher number of genes)

    wrap

    value used to wrap long gene-sets names as a description of communities. See `stringr::str_wrap()` for further details

    label_fontsize

    font size of the label and description of the communities. If two values are provided, the fist is used for label, the second for description. See `ggforce::geom_mark_rect()` for further details.

    e_color

    edge color

    e_alpha

    edge transparency

    e_range

    range of widths values used for plotting edges proportional to similarity score

    v_stroke

    width of the stoke of the vertices, which is colored according to communities

    v_range

    range of dimensions of the vertices, which is proportional to the number of genes

    save_plot

    TRUE/FALSE, if the plot should be saved by using `file_prefix` or returned

    width

    jpeg image width

    height

    jpeg image height

    res

    jpeg image resolution

    units

    jpeg image units for width and height

    Value

    The function returns a list containing:

    • igraph = network object used for plotting the enrichment map

    • network_data = data.frame with layout (X1,X2 columns), name of the gene-sets together with community ids ("comm_id"), score and number of genes ("n_genes")

    • path_comm_genes = list composed by the genes present in each community

    • sim_coeff = data.frame with the similarity score calculated between each gene-set pair

    • plot = enrichment map plot obtained by using `ggraph` package functions. Only if `save_plot = FALSE`

    Details

    enrichment_map() function calculates similarities between each gene-set pair by using `method` metric. Subsequently, these similarities are filtered to maintain the ones >= `coeff`. `comm_method` algorithm is then used to identify communities, which may be filtered to plot only the ones composed by at least `min_comm_size` gene-sets. Enrichment map is then plotted by using `ggraph` package.

    On this page
